title: Veggie Lasagna
steps: Pre-heat oven to 375 F.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat, then sauté the broccoli, onion, and red peppers for 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoe sauce and cook another 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, cheddar cheese, and eggs.
In two 9 x 13 inch greased casserole dishes, repeat 3 layers of: (1/6) of the sauce-veggies mixture, 2-3 noodles, (1/6) of the cheese mixture.
Optional: top with a thin layer of tomatoe sauce and cheddar cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: In a large bowl, combine butter, brown sugar, white sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. Stir very well.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Mix very well, then add the chocolate chips.
Chill dough in refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Pre-heat oven to 350 F.
On parchment-lined cookie pans, scoop dough into 1.5 T blobs, about 5 cm apart.
Bake for 11 minutes, then remove to cool and continue solidifying for another 10.

title: Quinoa Beet Salad
steps: Pre-heat oven to 400 F.
In a large bowl, toss beets and carrots in 1 t red wine vinegar and 2 t olive oil.
In a large baking tray, bake beets and carrots for 45 minutes. Stir half-way through cooking.
Combine vegetable broth and quinoa. Bring to a boil uncovered, then  cover and simmer until quinoa is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Make the dressing: combine Dijon mustard, remaining red wine vinegar and olive oil.
Combine cooked quinoa, chopped kale, and baked beets and carrots. Pour dressing over salad.

title: Coconut Curry Lentil Soup
steps: In a large pot over medium heat, sauté onion and garlic for 5 minutes.
Add lentils and stir for about 1 minute.
Add remaining ingredients and increase heat to high.
After the soup comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 12 minutes.
In a fry pan over medium-low heat, toast almonds until they just begin to brown. Remove from heat immediately.
Garnish soup with almonds and serve.

title: Cous-Cous Stuffed Peppers
steps: Pre-heat oven to 375 F.
In a small saucepan, combine broth, salt, oil, lemon juice, curry powder, cayenne, and garlic. Bring to a boil over high heat, stir in cous-cous. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand 15 min.
In a small skillet over medium heat, toast the walnuts.
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, celery, green onions, dried cranberries, and feta cheese.
Mix in toasted walnuts, cooked cous-cous and eggs.
Cut peppers in half, place on a baking sheet, and stuff with mixture.
Bake stuffed peppers for 20 minutes.

title: Broccoli Cheddar Quiche
steps: Pre-heat oven to 400 F.
To make the crust, mix together cheese, flour, mustard, butter, and salt. Press evenly onto bottom and sides of a 10-inch pie dish.
In a large pan over medium-high heat, sauté broccoli and onions for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook another 2 minutes.
To make the filling, mix together eggs evaporated milk, nutmeg, and pepper. Add broccoli, onions, and mushrooms.
Pour filling into the crust.
Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 F, then bake another 20 minutes, or until a knife in the centre comes out clean.

title: Peanut Butter Protein Balls
steps: Combine all ingredients together. Mix thoroughly.
Roll into 1 inch balls (about 20) and cool in the fridge.

title: Chickpeak "Chicken Salad" Sandwiches
steps: Create the sauce: combine hummus, lemon juice, garlic, soy milk, and 0.5 T dill.
In a large bowl, mash chickpeas in a large bowl for texture.
To make the filling, add to the chickpeas: sunflower seeds, onion, tahini, Dijon mustard, maple syrup, and remaining dill.
Toast the bread.
Slather the sauce on one slice of bread. On the other, layer the filling, spinach, apple slices, and the first slice.

title: Frankies: Bombay burritos
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 F.
Peel, dice, and boil the potatoes for about 25 minutes.
Cut the cauliflower into medium florets, and drain the chickpeas.
Toss the cauliflower and chickpeas together in oil, cumin, coriander, chili flakes, and 1 t salt (not curry powder), then roast for about 20 minutes.
For pickled onions: thinly slice the onion.
Bring equal parts vinegar and water to a boil in a small pot. Add sugar, sliced onion, and (optional) whole spices. Simmer for 30 seconds, then let cool.
Drain the boiled potatoes but keep about 0.5 C water. Mash the potatoes to a spreadable consistency, adding curry powder, and 1 t salt.
Make or buy the chutney (recipe in source link).
Assemble the burritos: spread the potatoes on tortillas as a base. Add roasted cauliflower and chickpea filling. Top with pickled onions, spinach, and chutney.

title: Kale Fiesta Salad
steps: For the dressing, combine olive oil, lime juice, diced jalapenos, honey, cumin, coriander, and salt. Shake well.
Dress the kale, and top with black beans, cranberries, feta cheese, toasted pumpkin seeds, and crumbled tortilla chips.

title: Blueberry Oatmeal Yogurt Pancakes
steps: Combine dry ingredients: flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt.
Combine wet ingredients: yogurt, milk, butter, eggs.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, then add blueberries and gently toss.
On a non-stick pan over medium heat, scoop 1/3 C batter into small pancakes.
Cook until bubbles appear on top, then flip, and cook for another 2 minutes.

title: Salmon Burgers
steps: In a medium bowl, flake salmon and mix with eggs, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, and chili powder.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Pack the mixture into patties, and fry for about 5 minutes per side.
Mix the Sriracha sauce and Greek yogurt to make the spicey mayo.
Top burger buns with cooked patties, spicey mayo, and other toppings.

title: Veggie Burgers
steps: Start cooking the brown rice.
In a skillet over medium heat, toast walnuts for 5-7 minutes. Set aside.
Heat half the oil over medium heat in the same skillet. Sauté onion for 4 minutes. Set aside.
Blend cooled walnuts with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, black pepper, and brown sugar. Set aside.
Mash cooked black beans to a paste.
Combine cooked brown rice, walnut-spice mixture, sautéed onion, mashed black beans, bread crumbs, and BBQ sauce. Mix well.
Heat the other half of the oil over medium heat in the same skillet. Divide mixture into 5 patties and place on skillet.
Cook 3-4 minutes per side, flipping gently.
